newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian state lists 10,000 gods on voters list.
newsitem.headline: Indian state lists 10,000 gods on voters list.

text.p: The presiding deities of some 10,000 temples in the southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh were listed to vote on Tuesday in local water users associations' polls, officials said.

They said the gods and goddesses were included in the rolls because the state government listed them as owners of several acres of land, who are entitled to elect representatives to decide on water usage.

Many temples in Andhra Pradesh possess vast tracts of land ranging from 10 acres (four hectares) to 1,000 acres (400 hectares). The property is registered in the presiding deity's name, with a photograph of the god or goddess affixed to the registration document.

The state's 11,156 water users associations, which comprise about 4.7 million members, have not decided who can cast the deities' ballots on their behalf. There are nearly 32,000 presiding deities in Andhra Pradesh.
